alert.note: Alert for Bell; Breathitt; Clay; Harlan; Knott; Knox; Laurel; Leslie; Magoffin; Owsley; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 8:05PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A Gusty Outflow Boundary and a few thunderstorms in advance of it will impact portions of west central Harlan, southeastern Laurel, northeastern Bell, northern Knox, southeastern Owsley, Leslie, northern Perry, northwestern Knott, Breathitt, southeastern Magoffin and Clay Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 803 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an outflow boundary and a few thunderstorms in advance of it along a line extending from Guerrant to Trixie to Jarvis. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Jackson, Curt, Mistletoe, Lucky Fork, Whoopflarea, Elkatawa, Canoe, Yeadon, Gentry and Brutus around 810 PM EDT. Haddix, Valjean, Quicksand, Howard Creek, Dumont, Inverness, Copland, Saldee, Dalesburg and Morris Fork around 815 PM EDT. Buckhorn, Flintville, Lost Creek, Clayhole, Smith Branch, Wilstacy, Portsmouth, Press, Saul and Watts around 820 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Buckhorn Lake S.P., Gays Creek, Hardshell, Shoal, Beech, Sikes, Ice Cliff, Bush Branch, Brightshade, Altro, Erose, Krypton, Noble, Mills, Mosley Bend, Chavies, Confluence, Field, Barwick, Toulouse, Gardner, Lamont, Skidmore, Daisydell, Lambric, Ary, Sandy Fork, Beverly, Buck, Decoy, Dice, Queendale, Avawam, Roark, Talcum, Stony Fork Junction, Hazard, Elmrock, Spruce Pine, Saylor, Bulan, Warbranch, Vail, Tacky Town, Evanston and Mozelle. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 14 and 59. Kentucky Highway 80 in Knott County between mile markers 1 and 3. Kentucky Highway 80 in Perry County between mile markers 9 and 15. U.S. Highway 25 East in Knox County between mile markers 5 and 7, and between mile markers 12 and 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bell; Breathitt; Clay; Harlan; Knott; Knox; Laurel; Leslie; Magoffin; Owsley; Perry
